# Math (Stats Review)

## Common Data Formats

Data can often be represented by a _data matrix_ D

$$D = \begin{matrix}
 & X_1 & X_2 & X_3 & X_4 \\
x_1 & 0.2 & 23 & A & 5.7 \\
x_2 & 0.4 & 1 & B & 5.4 \\
x_3 & 1.8 & 0.5 & C & 5.2 \\
x_4 & 5.6 & 50 & A & 5.1 \\
x_5 & -0.5 & 34 & A & 5.3 \\
x_6 & 0.4 & 19 & B & 5.4 \\
x_7 & 1.1 & 11 & A & 5.5 \\
\end{matrix}$$

## Mean

Estimated mean (sample mean) of attribute $\hat{\mu}_j = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} x_{ij}$

## Variance

Estimated variance of $X_j$: $\hat{ \sigma }_{j}^{2} = \frac{1}{n-1} \sum_{i=1}^{n} ( x_{ij} - \hat{\mu})^{2}$

## Standard deviation

Estimated standard deviation of $X_j$: $\hat{ \sigma }_j = \sqrt{ \hat{ \sigma }_j^2 }$ _(square root of the estimated variance)_

## Multi-dimensional mean

$\hat{ \mu } = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i$

## Covariance

$\hat{ \sigma }_{1}^{2} = \frac{1}{n-1} \sum_{i=1}^{n} (x_{i1} - \hat{\mu}_1)(x_{i2} - \hat{\mu}_2)$
